Coming to Garner/South Raleigh in 2027

Why Redemption Grove Church?

Southern Wake County is one of the fastest growing areas in the country. The people moving here need to know about the life-giving hope found in Jesus Christ alone. Redemption means to be bought with a price, to be saved out of darkness, and a grove is grouping of healthy trees, planted, rooted, and bearing good fruit. In God's kindness and by his Spirit, that is what we hope to be as a church.

Why south Garner / north Fuquay-Varina?

Redemption Grove Church will serve the neighborhoods in south Garner and north Fuquay-Varina near I-540 and US 401. With the growth of Garner, Wake County, and Fuquay-Varina, North Carolina, more churches are needed to build up Christians, make disciples, and serve families and singles in this area, in Jesus' name.

Our Pastor & Team

Pastor Corey Staton has served in full-time pastoral ministry for 12 years. He is a native of Fuquay-Varina and a graduate of Campbell University and Shepherds Theological Seminary. He and his wife, Carrie, have four boys. In addition to Corey, Josh Houghton and Michael Nootbaar will serve as elders, and together they are helped by an Advisory Board made up of leaders of Redemption Grove's sending church, Redeemer Community Church, Fuquay-Varina, NC.

If you are interested in joining our church plant, come to our next interest meeting to find out more information! Sign up here to be notified about our next meeting.

Partner Through Giving

Financial support is necessary for any church plant to thrive the early years of getting established. If you desire to support Redemption Grove Church in this way, you can give online here.

Join Our Prayer Team

Psalm 127:1 reminds us, “Unless the Lord builds a house, its builders labor over it in vain.” Church planting does not happen without many people praying along the way. Please subscribe to our monthly newsletter and become one of our prayer partners.

“In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace...”
